titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I celebrated in the Cathedral at 8 a.m., bethinking me sadly of the faults & failures of my 26 years' ministry. The Ordination was impressively performed. I joined in the laying on of hands, and ministered the Paten. I attended Evensong in the Cathedral: & afterwards preached in S. Nicholas' Church. There was a considerable congregation. The service was hearty, but the officiating gave me an impression of laboured unctuousness, which was distinctly unpleasing.
Budworth, Knowling, & Deaconess Irwin came to supper.

body.p: Mrs Prothero came to lunch. I shewed her over the Church before Evensong.
